keyTakeAways: The United States conducted its seventh strike on a boat allegedly involved in drug trafficking in the Caribbean, targeting a vessel linked to a Colombian terrorist organization.
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth confirmed that three men on the boat were killed, with no US personnel harmed, and described drug cartels as the 'Al Qaeda of the Western Hemisphere.'

This action follows a broader hardline strategy under the Trump administration to combat illicit drug trafficking, including authorizing CIA operations in Venezuela and considering military action against Nicolás Maduro.

The US has produced a classified legal opinion justifying lethal strikes on suspected drug traffickers, potentially allowing designation as enemy combatants and summary execution without legal review.
Critics, including Senator Rand Paul and Lisa Murkowski, have raised concerns over the lack of due process, calling such actions 'terrible ideas' and advocating for congressional oversight.
Colombian President Gustavo Petro criticized the US for allegedly killing an innocent national, prompting Trump to cancel all US payments and subsidies to Colombia.
Petro denied involvement in drug trafficking, framing the incident as a breach of sovereignty and diplomatic tension.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The U.S. conducted its seventh military strike in the Caribbean against a vessel suspected of drug trafficking, linked to a Colombian terrorist organization. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth stated that the three individuals on board were killed, with no U.S. casualties, and called drug cartels 'the Al Qaeda of the Western Hemisphere'. This action is part of a broader Trump administration strategy targeting drug traffickers and using lethal force, including CIA operations in Venezuela and threats against President Nicolás Maduro. The move has sparked diplomatic tensions with Colombian President Gustavo Petro, who accused the U.S. of killing a civilian, prompting Trump to cancel all U.S. payments to Colombia. Critics, including Senators Rand Paul and Lisa Murkowski, have raised alarms over the lack of due process, calling the policy of summary executions a violation of legal norms. A classified legal opinion justifies the designation of traffickers as enemy combatants, enabling lethal action without trial—marking a significant shift from traditional law enforcement methods like Coast Guard interdiction.
title: US conducts seventh strike on boat allegedly involved in drug trafficking in the Caribbean
